intro: Conostylis aemula, commonly known as the slender flat sedge, is a perennial herb native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as swamps and waterlogged soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikes. Conostylis aemula is often found in coastal and wetland habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these areas.
